awe6.interfaces.IMessageManager

type
interface
implements
IResettable
The IMessageManager should be implemented by objects intending to fulfill Entity to Entity synchronous messaging (also known as events or signals).

The interface provides an observer pattern oriented manager allowing any Entity to listen to anything on any other Entity.

Note, the author is not a fan of observer pattern and provides this manager with a note of caution - there is always a better way to communicate than to fire shots into the dark!

This manager is intentionally abstract / generic. It allows expressive synchronous events - i.e. use anything as a message (string, enumerator, class, state based object etc).

It may make more sense to handle events using an alternative, event or signal specific library. Adapt one as an IEntity and inject into any scene as needed.

Instance Methods

addSubscriber<M>( subscriber : IEntity, message : addSubscriber.M, handler : addSubscriber.M -> IEntity -> Bool, ?sender : IEntity, ?senderClassType : Class<IEntity>, ?isRemovedAfterFirstSend : Bool ) : Void

types
<M> Messages can be any type: String, Class, Enum. For recursive types use Enums.
parameters
subscriber Entity listening / observing for messages.
message Specific message to listen for.
handler Function to pass observed messages to: receives Message & Sender and returns true if send propogation is to continue (true should be default behavior).
?sender Only listen to messages from this entity.
?senderClassType Only listen to messages from this type of entity.
?isRemovedAfterFirstSend Once a message has been received, no longer listen for further messages under the same criteria.
Register an entity's interest in a subject.

getSubscribers<M>( ?subscriber : IEntity, ?message : getSubscribers.M, ?handler : getSubscribers.M -> IEntity -> Bool, ?sender : IEntity, ?senderClassType : Class<IEntity> ) : Array<IEntity>

types
<M> Messages can be any type: String, Class, Enum. For recursive types use Enums.
parameters
?subscriber Entity listening / observing for messages.
?message Specific message to listen for.
?handler Function to pass observed messages to.
?sender Only listen to messages from this entity.
?senderClassType Only listen to messages from this type of entity.
returns
An array of entities corresponding to the specified filters.
Retrieve all entity's interested in a subject.

All parameters are optional to allow wildcard filtering.

removeSubscribers<M>( ?subscriber : IEntity, ?message : removeSubscribers.M, ?handler : removeSubscribers.M -> IEntity -> Bool, ?sender : IEntity, ?senderClassType : Class<IEntity> ) : Void

types
<M> Messages can be any type: String, Class, Enum. For recursive types use Enums.
parameters
?subscriber Entity listening / observing for messages.
?message Specific message to listen for.
?handler Function to pass observed messages to.
?sender Only listen to messages from this entity.
?senderClassType Only listen to messages from this type of entity.
Unsubscribes entities matching the specified criteria.

sendMessage<M>( message : sendMessage.M, sender : IEntity, ?isBubbleDown : Bool, ?isBubbleUp : Bool, ?isBubbleEverywhere : Bool ) : Void

types
<M> Messages can be any type: String, Class, Enum. For recursive types use Enums.
parameters
message Message to dispatch.
sender The originator of the message (can be spoofed).
?isBubbleDown Set to true if you want to dispatch this message to the sender's children.
?isBubbleUp Set to true if you want to dispatch this message to the sender's parent.
?isBubbleEverywhere Set to true if you want to dispatch this message to the entity traversal stack.
Dispatch a message from a specific entity.
